Today's Verse: Ps. 39:4

Lord, remind me how brief my time on earth will be.

Remind me that my days are numbered- how fleeting my life is. 

Today's Thoughts:

Life is short no matter how long we live. If there is something 

important we want to do, we should not put it off for a better day.

Ask yourself if I had only six months to live, what would I do?



Tell someone that you love him or her?

Deal with an undisciplined area in your life?

Tell someone about Jesus?

Because life is short don't neglect what is truly important.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, it is so easy to get caught up in the busyness of life that 

I often forget how fleeting life really is. Help me to focus on what 

is truly important-eternal life. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If you confess with your mouth, "Jesus is Lord," and believe in your heart 

that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. (Ro. 10:9)

Today's Verses: Ps. 39:5-6

You have made my life no longer than the width of my hand. 

My entire lifetime is just a moment to you; at best, each of us is but a
breath." 
6 We are merely moving shadows, and all our busy rushing ends in nothing. 

We heap up wealth, not knowing who will spend it. 

Today's Thoughts:

The shortness of life is the theme throughout the books of Psalm, Proverbs,
and Ecclesiastes. 

Remember Jesus also spoke about this subject in Lk. 12:20. Now isn't it
funny how people 

spend so much time securing their lives on earth but take little time or
thought about where 

they will spend eternity. David realized that putting together riches and
busily accomplishing 

worldly tasks would make no difference in eternity. It seems that very few
people understand 

that their only hope is in the Lord.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me to cast my cares on You, 

trusting in Your loving care for me. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

This is how we know what love is: 

Jesus Christ laid down His life for us. (I Jn. 3:16)

Today's Verses: Ps. 39:8-9

8 Rescue me from my rebellion. Do not let fools mock me.

9 I am silent before you; I won't say a word, for my punishment is from you.


Today's Thoughts:

I believe that many people believe that God protects them from trouble, 

so when calamity comes, they begin to question God's goodness and justice.

But in truth we should never give up on God, just because He allows you to 

have a bad experience. Remember that faith in God does not guarantee
personal 

prosperity, and of course lack of faith does not guarantee troubles in this
life.

If this were so, people would believe in God simply to get rich. God is
perfectly 

able to recue us from suffering, but He also may allow suffering to come for


reasons we cannot understand. It is Satan's strategy to get us to doubt God
at 

exactly this moment. If we always knew why we were suffering, our faith
would 

have no room to grow.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, give me a child-like faith, for only You can. Remove my doubts 

and fill me with a simple faith in Your precious promises. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Anyone who will not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child

will never enter it. (Mk. 10:15)

Today's Verse: Ps. 39:10

But please stop striking me! I am exhausted by the blows from your hand. 

Today's Thoughts:

What did David mean when he asked God to stop punishing him with "blows"
from His hand?

It may be a picture of the difficulties David was facing that cause him to
feel as if he were being struck.

(Question) who loves a child more-the father who allows the child to do
what will harm him-or one 

who corrects, trains, and even punishes the child to help him learn what is
right?



It is never pleasant to be corrected and disciplined by God, but His
discipline is a sign of His deep love 

for us. When God corrects you, see it as proof of His love, and ask Him
what He is trying to teach you.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, show me my sins with Your commandments.

Then show me Your forgiveness through the good news 

about Your Son, my Savior. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not only 

for ours but also for the sins of the whole world. (I Jn. 2:2)

Today's Verses: Ps. 39:11-12

When you discipline us for our sins, you consume like a moth what is
precious to us. 

Each of us is but a breath. 
12 Hear my prayer, O Lord! Listen to my cries for help! Don't ignore my
tears. 

For I am your guest- a traveler passing through, as my ancestors were before
me. 

Today's Thoughts:

Once again we have a reminder that we should be mindful of our place and 

be submissive before the Almighty God. We should see that God's eternal 

nature is contrasted with our frailty-And that our time is limited and we 

should use it wisely-NOT living for the moment-BUT with our eternal 

home in mind. .

Today' Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me always to offer my thankfulness for

Your grace and mercy each and every day. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"The Lord your God is gracious and compassionate.

He will not turn His face from you if you return to Him." (2 Chron. 30:9)

Todays Verses: Ps. 39:13

Spare me so I can smile again before I am gone and exist no more.

Today's Thoughts:

By verse 13 it would seem that David was becoming impatient but before 

we make such a judgment call let us read vss.1-3 of chap. 40

Ps. 40:1-3

I waited patiently for the Lord to help me, and he turned to me and heard my
cry.

2 He lifted me out of the pit of despair, out of the mud and the mire. He
set my feet 

on solid ground and steadied me as I walked along.

3 He has given me a new song to sing, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will
see what 

He has done and be amazed. They will put their trust in the Lord. 

Further Thoughts:

Through David's waiting he had become discouraged-it's not always easy
waiting for God's helpBut David received 4 benefits from waiting: 

(1) God lifted him out of despair;

(2) He set his feet on solid ground,

(3) He steadied him as he walked, and

(4) He put a new song of praise in his mouthQuiet often blessings cannot be received unless we go through the trial of
waiting.

So let's remember to always pray for patience. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, help me not to become discouraged while waiting on Your timingHelp me remember that blessings come with patience. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Let your gentleness be evident to all.

The Lord is near." Phil 4:5

Today's Verses: Ps. 40:4-6

Oh, the joys of those who trust the Lord, who have no confidence in the
proud or in those who worship idols

5 O Lord my God, You have performed many wonders for us. Your plans for us
are too numerous to list. 

You have no equal. If I tried to recite all Your wonderful deeds, I would
never come to the end of them. 
6 You take no delight in sacrifices or offerings. Now that You have made me
listen, I finally understand You don't require burnt offerings or sin offerings. 

Today's Thoughts:

The religious rituals of David's day involved sacrificing animals in the
tabernacle. BUT David saidThese acts were meaningless unless done for the right reasons. TODAY we
often make rituals of going

to church-taking Communion-or paying tithes. These activities are also empty
if our reasons for 

doing them are selfishGod does not want these sacrifices and offerings without an attitude of
devotion to Him.

Samuel said, "Obedience is far better than sacrifice." (I Sam. 15:22)

Make sure you give God the obedience and life-long service He desires from
you.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, cover me with Your Son's forgiveness that I may be 

pure in Your sight. Amen.

Today's Verses: Ps. 40: 7-8

Then I said, "Look, I have come. As is written about me in the Scriptures:

8 I take joy in doing Your will, my God, for your instructions are written
on my heart." 

Today's Thoughts:

"I take joy in doing Your will, my God." In John 4:34, 5:30 we see that
Jesus

portrayed this attitude of obeying and serving God. He came as the prophets 

foretold, proclaiming the Good News of God's righteousness and forgiveness 

of sins. 

How often have we excused ourselves from doing God's will-(witnessing for
Him)?

Have you ever used the excuse that your family or friends are not ready to
believe?

Well Jesus makes it clear that all around us there is a continual harvest
which waits 

to be harvested.

Don't let Jesus find you making excuses-If you look around you I am sure you
will 

find people ready to hear God's Word.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the mind of Christ be in me, to do Your
will 

in all things, that I may finish Your work-in Jesus name Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Have this mind in you, which was also in Christ Jesus. (Phil. 2:5)

I have told all your people about your justice. I have not been afraid to
speak out, as you, O Lord, well know.

10 I have not kept the good news of your justice hidden in my heart; I have
talked about your faithfulness and 

saving power. I have told everyone in the great assembly of your unfailing

David said he would speak of God's faithfulness and salvation to those
around him.

When we fully realize the impact of God's righteousness on our lives, we
will not be 

able to keep it hidden. We will want to tell other people what God has done
for us.

IF God's faithfulness has changed your life, don't be timid. It is natural
to share a 

good bargain with others or recommend a skillful doctor. So it should also
be natural 

to share what God has done for you. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, teach me the blessedness of knowing Jesus and the
power of 

His love, so that I may find the greatest joy in witnessing to what He is
and has done 

for me. Amen

Today's Verses: Ps. 40:16-17

16 But may all who search for You be filled with joy and gladness in You.

May those who love Your salvation repeatedly shout, "The Lord is great!"

17 As for me, since I am poor and needy, let the Lord keep me in His
thoughts. 

You are my helper and my savior. O my God, do not delay. 

Today's Thoughts:

We have in verse 16 a common and natural confession that should be on 

the lips of every Christian-"The Lord is great!" 

As saints and sinners, we are unable to keep God's Law perfectly, even
though

He requires that we do so. BUT by the power of His Word and Spirit and by
faith,

He instills in us a new desire-to live more perfectly.

Our Lord Jesus kept the Law perfectly and died on our behalf that we might
live 

with Him in His kingdom.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, help me, that by Your grace I might learn Your commandments more 

completely each and every day. Preserve me I pray, that by Your Holy Spirit

I will never become ungrateful and seek after this world's vanity or other
gods.

Help me to cling truly and solely to You, I pray in Jesus Name. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

original_verse_text: But may all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; may those who long for your saving help always say, "The Lord is great!"
prayer: O Lord, help me, that by Your grace I might learn Your commandments more completely each and every day. Preserve me I pray, that by Your Holy Spirit I will never become ungrateful and seek after this world's vanity or other gods. Help me to cling truly and solely to You, I pray in Jesus Name. Amen.
reflection: We have in verse 16 a common and natural confession that should be on the lips of every Christian-"The Lord is great!" As saints and sinners, we are unable to keep God's Law perfectly, even though He requires that we do so. BUT by the power of His Word and Spirit and by faith, He instills in us a new desire-to live more perfectly. Our Lord Jesus kept the Law perfectly and died on our behalf that we might live with Him in His kingdom.
subject: Greatness of the Lord
